website_summaries.verdict: A gaming headset from HyperX focused on great talkback capabilities for clear communication.
pros: The oversized sound drivers in the speakers have great presence and dynamics for enhancing the gaming experience
Microphone offers clear audio input for gaming communication
cons: Headset runs on the smaller side of sizing
Not suitable for larger head sizes

customer_reviews.title: Best Headphones I've Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: So I had been streaming for a while and the mic was picking up every single sound. (hold on, read more) I was furious and returned them for a new pair and it did the same thing! Well guys, it was an operator error. My OBS software had been using my webcam mic the whole time. I set it to the HyperX Cloud headset mic and oh...my god....no more loud kids in the background. No more picking up my keyboard typing...it was finally silent! Only my voice could be heard! I'm extremely happy with this headset. It's cozy (even with glasses), the sound is crisp and clear, and the mic is just the best!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Volume wheel causes static
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the audio and comfort of the set doesn't mean much when the sound is constantly clipping and static-y due to the delicate volume adjuster on the cord. Touch it ever so slightly, or say move you body just a smidgen and you'll brush against the chest high volume wheel that isn't weighted against anything. A millimeter of movement is enough to lower the volume, which would be annoying enough, but it causes the sound to be uneven and clip out of one ear, leaving the other playing at near full volume. I've had these less than 2 months, gentle use.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Sounds cuts in and out due to touchy inline volume control
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this headset. It's really comfortable and the sound quality is great... when I can hear it. But right from the beginning the inline volume control was touchy and would cause static if it moved at all (e.g. from brushing against my shirt). It's only gotten worse over time, to the point where the other night I ripped the headset off in frustration and just used the default input/output on my laptop because I couldn't hear the other people I was gaming with. I'm surprised Wirecutter still recommends this as their top pick. My advice: Stay away, far away. This was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great- seems like the best value
customer_reviews.text: I am not a headset expert and this is the first headset I owned for my gaming system aside from the cheap one that came with it. However, these seems like the quality I would want from any headset, so I am happy with them. The cost was less than some of the more well known ones, so I considers these a win and a great value. Also.. very comfy even with my big ears..
customer_reviews.author: Joel Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming headset for the $$
customer_reviews.text: My son's talked me into trying these out as they love theirs and I needed a new set. I bought them a while back when they were on sale and haven't regretted my purchase on bit. I know there are better headsets out there but for the money, these are a win for me. They do what I need and being bald, they are quite comfortable for many hours of use. Other headsets tend to get uncomfortable and hurt the top of my head after only a short while. Also, I wear glasses and was worried that these would get uncomfortable because of that however I've got no complaints. Totally would recommend these to anyone looking for a solid headset.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Naylor

customer_reviews.title: Was nice for 6 weeks anyway..
customer_reviews.text: I love the headset, it is very comfortable even for hours gaming. Sound is awesome. I gave it three stars for one problem - after not even 6 weeks, the mic has totally stopped working. I have all settings correct on all voice programs that I use (Discord, TeamSpeak etc), I can hear everyone else, they can't hear me. I plug in another headset and they hear me fine. So, bad mic. Not good considering the price and it's only been 6 weeks. I will give it a few weeks here and either update to 5 stars if the manufacturer honors the warranty and corrects the problem in a suitable way, or 1 star if I have an $80 paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: BurghGal

customer_reviews.title: Headset works great... mic, not so much.
customer_reviews.text: The headset itself works great, and has good sound, but the mic does not work at all... I've troubleshooted everything I can think of. I am no stranger to technology and after hours of trying to get this to work, I am forced to give up and admit I either have a faulty version, or it's just defunct. :/ Sucks because the mic was the reason I bought the headset to begin with. Put in for a return... hopefully I can get an exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Justine Tippie

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than a year with minimal use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this headset back in March and it's already broken. The audio is staticy and constantly cuts in and out, making the headset useless. Nothing is physically broken on the headset, wire is not frayed in any place and the jack isnt visibly damaged anywhere. Was never used heavily as I don't spend much time gaming as previously. Pretty frustrating the product broke with less than 50 hours of use within 11 months. Would not recommend at all as the longevity is basically nothing.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I haven't owned many headsets, but I love the quality of this product. It's a good mid-range product that definitely sounds better and feels better than many cheaper products on the market. I think it was worth a step up from some of the $20-30 sets work just fine, but tend to be uncomfortable, have sound that doesn't feel quite right, or whatever other problems may occur when you... get what you spend. Worthy upgrade from my base Playstation and Microsoft gear that I'm used to using. HyperX will be my new favorite for gaming across all consoles and PC from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Xander Danger

customer_reviews.title: BEST xbox 1 headset available (IMHO)  !!!
customer_reviews.text: Plug em in to new xbox 1 controller WITH the 3.5 headphone jack and play. AWESOME! I had turtles, shame on you turtlebeach after giving us such great 360 headsets, and AG afterglow (not too bad but wanted better... for gaming, Afterglows were way better than turtles). I got mine from amazon llc, they shipped fast and I love em...SOLID QUALITY construction, perfect design, very comfortable for many hours of gaming, and they just sound so awesome! Bonus if you have the GOW White xbox 1 like I do cause the y are a perfect match with the lunar white controller and system. A steal at 70 buks, I would have paid full price. Well worth it. Thank you amazon.
customer_reviews.author: DWA

customer_reviews.title: Great First Gaming Headset
customer_reviews.text: I was looking into buying a separate pair of headphones and microphone, which works for some, but decided to buy this headset which includes both. This HyperX Cloud Pro gaming headset is great for gaming. Long time comfort, great sound and microphone, and decent passive noise cancellation. The only things I would suggest improving is a longer adjusting headband for larger heads and a braided cable that doesn't constantly get twisted. Other than these, I would highly recommend them for beginning or advanced gamers.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, great sound quality, great mic.
customer_reviews.text: I love this headset. I had a $30 (on sale) pair of turtle beach headphones before this and immediately I could tell the difference between them and this one. Either pair of ear inserts (whatever their called) are super comfy and sound good. The leather ones are a little less comfy after wearing for a long time so I use the other pair. Replacable mic is a god send in case you somehow break yours you don't need to buy a whole new headset. Cables for the headset let it be plugged into anything you could imagine. 10/10 best headset.
customer_reviews.author: Garet Helmken

customer_reviews.title: Broken inline controls
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is reasonable for what you pay for. Not worse than competitors, but not much better. However, the inline audio control leaves much to be desired. The volume wheel creates scratchy feedback when used, and some positions of the wheel mute either one earcup or the other. The mute switch for the microphone will not mute audio input, but will only make it quieter. Further, regardless of whether the microphone is muted or not, there is a great amount of bleedthrough when using the mic--if in a voice call, other members of the call will hear the user's audio output. Attempting to exchange the product for a second one under Kingston's warranty did not solve the issue.
customer_reviews.author: nyusha

customer_reviews.title: Great product ... until the jack broke
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones for my husband to use to skype into game nights with his friends. He absolutely loved them--very comfortable and excellent sound quality--until they broke. The jack snapped off while plugged into the computer. Now his computer's audio doesn't work (since the computer thinks that there are headphones plugged in), and the headphones are completely useless. This happened about a week after product support expired--very disappointing. I don't think we'd buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable headphones I have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: Hey guys. These are the most comfortable headphones I have ever used. I have had the turtle beach elite 800's at around 300 bucks, and el cheapo headphones at 20. These are the most comfortable and best sounding headphones I have used. My only problem is the little in line volume control can be a little funky. Sometimes. But I usually don't have an issue with it. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Review This!

customer_reviews.title: They sound great and are pretty comfortable, but they aren't durable at all.
customer_reviews.text: The first set I had my buddy bought me and they fell off my desk and one side stopped working so I thought "Oh that sucks, but it was my fault and I liked them so I'll get a new pair." So I bought a new pair and had it for about 3 months, and the cord slightly caught on my chair arm for a second and now makes this horrible feedback noise and I've tried it on my PC and PS4 so I know its the headset. I bought the extended warranty but that only covers the product if it stops working on its own. So I do not recommend this product or its ripoff of a warranty.
customer_reviews.author: caleb

customer_reviews.title: Husband happy --> wife happy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace my husband’s old PC gaming headphones. He is now a much happier man. They work well for his gaming, and he has used them with microphone for multi-hour gaming sessions with no problem. One feature he likes is that they block out so much outside sound. The clanging of stuff in the kitchen doesn’t get hid attention anymore.... I am adjusting. I have used them a few times to listen to web stuff and am amazed at the sound quality for the price. Even if you don’t know much about headphones, this set is a safe bet for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Kalatraza

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: These broke with-in a month of normal use. One of the earbuds sometimes works and sometimes does not. If I switch from my TV audio to the headphone audio it makes a loud hissing/distortion noise that is resolved by restarting my PC. I have sent this back to the Manufacturer to be RMAed. Once I get my new pair will update.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Frye

customer_reviews.title: Great headset, but not quite perfect
customer_reviews.text: I've owned these for a little over a year now, and I can honestly say they're a great buy if you're in the market for a gaming headset. The cord is a little short until you add the included extension cable with control box, and the band seems it should go one notch bigger to accommodate people with large heads, but overall I love the sound that they produce and the microphone comes through very clearly. They're not perfect, but they're a heck of a lot better than any other options in this price range. You won't find anything better for less than 80 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler A.

customer_reviews.title: Got uncomfortable with glasses, but probably the best for what they do at their price
customer_reviews.text: Sound is better than expected, but fits the price point. Quality is very good: pads are good, cables are good. You'll probably be adjusting it's sound and mic settings in your OS' general settings for it, which I would highly recommend. Comfort wise, wearing with glasses got uncomfortable after half a day's work, which is fine but not perfect. Really just too tight - you could probably bend them out if you want to, since it's metal-like and would snug your head less, but not necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Greatest headset I've ever owned BUT...
customer_reviews.text: Best headsets I've ever owned in all regards, HOWEVER, be very careful with the volume wheel I've replaced mine twice because they've been faulty either by causing feedback or loss of sound quality. Luckily having them replaced via Amazon is very easy and very quick so no complaints other than I highly suggest trying to find a version that doesn't have the volume wheel unless you absolutely need it.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome headset! 10/10 Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome headset, worth the money. I've had mine for over a year now and have no complaints. I know it seems a bit pricey, but I went through two $25 headsets before I figured I'd drop the money on a higher quality headset. I know more money doesn't always mean better quality, but these are nice quality. I've had long game sessions without these things bothering me at all. Plus, it comes with an adapter for Xbox/PS4, so you can use it on your consoles or your pc. 10/10 great buy
customer_reviews.author: DryBones91

customer_reviews.title: So many issues
customer_reviews.text: They are a solid pair of headphones from the outset, but they quickly devolve into a myriad of problems. Mic won't pick up sound, the background noises are ear piercing, the mute function its busted, and some other small issues. I'm pretty careful with my headset with cord holders and the like, so I don't believe it's something I did on my side.
customer_reviews.author: Star Zinico Marsh

customer_reviews.title: It works great for all three of those
customer_reviews.text: I actually got this as a headset for VOIP conference calls, and with gaming and listening to music as an additional bonus. It works great for all three of those, although obviously it's not extremely sensitive in audio quality for music aficionados. My voice comes through loud and clear even after my puppy gnawed on the mic 10 minutes after it came out of the box. All the adapters I could ever imagine needing are included, and it's extremely comfortable to wear (I have a lot of hair, tiny ears and wear glasses when I work, this combination has been really hard to find a good match for). All in all I'm extremely happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Anky

customer_reviews.title: If you have big ears and a big head like me. This is the headset to buy.
customer_reviews.text: I use this headset with the fiber vs leather cups cause my ears get sweaty on prolonged gaming and cloth pads will prevent this. Amazing audio, stick to 3.5mm for best sound. Excellent mic, long enough cord and extra cords are a plus. Would recommend over cloud 2 any day. Also if you are a tall person looking for a good headset this is for you. Oval earcups fit my ears perfect and it feels like im wearing a, wait for it, "Cloud". Best budget headset and beat out my old siberia v2 and senheisers hd280 by a magnitude of 1000. Buy this headset. You will be glad that you did.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Clark

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these...
customer_reviews.text: I've owned these since 2015... that should say a looooot. They are still functioning and I've never had to send them in for repair. The only thing I've had to replace is the Controller Box. I've use them DAILY for gaming hours on end since my purchase. The sound quality is great and as far as I've been told by my team mates in-game, I sound very clear. They are the most comfortable headset I've purchased for extended use. My partner has also made no mention of loud sound leakage from the headset. I'm extremely happy with the product I received.
customer_reviews.author: orenji

customer_reviews.title: A comfortable headset that sounds great at a killer price!
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these. One for home, and one for work. I am VERY particular about the sound and comfort of anything that straps in tight to my ears! No, these are not noise cancelling headphones; but that’s what I actually love about them! When I wear them I am as immersed as I need to be without cutting off the rest of the world entirely. If you’re in the market for a sub $70 headset, this one is a no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: nkCowmaster

customer_reviews.title: HyperX Cloud Pro Gaming Headsetin-Line Audio Control for PS4, Xbox One, and PC (HX-HSCL-SR/NA
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -one of the largest drivers on the market at 53 mm. Yes, they're powerfully loud. -Excellent noise cancellation, just the game. -Very good sound location (circumaural, Hyper X calls it) -works great with my Elite Wireless controller Cons: -The microphone has never worked from day one. Iv'e had the unit for about 9 months now and only use them as backup. Too bad. The speakers are really good in these things.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Mcmanus

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a gamer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband who loves gaming-if Steam has released a game, I'm pretty sure he has it. He loves them! They're a great upgrade from his older Logitech headphones, and MUCH more comfortable. (I tried them on once he opened the box, so I can confirm that.) He often communicates with other players so the speaker function comes in handy, too. They're not the cheapest on the market (or, for that matter, the most expensive), but they're a great gift for a gamer who takes it seriously without going completely broke. Amazon has the best price on them, too. Definitely recommended!
customer_reviews.author: J. Maclauchlan

customer_reviews.title: Failing after a few months like a dollar store pair. Not worth the price for the quality.
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a few months, now audio only comes in through the left ear unless i push really hard on the dial to max audio. Never heard back from support for a replacement, typical. Companies only ever do anything when you complain publicly where potential buyers will see and decide not to get them... Just like what i'm doing right now.
customer_reviews.author: Aurora

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed and wish I wasn't
customer_reviews.text: Love the look of these headphones. I love how comfortable they feel. I love how expensive they look even though they are affordable. I DON"T LIKE how the right ear volume goes in and out. I have only used these with my Xbox, so I can't say they would still do that if hooked to a computer. No headphones, no matter the cost, should have issues with sound going in and out. If it wasn't for that, this would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: WickedSanctuary

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I hoped, the Cloud II headset is much better.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't care for these at all. Arrived defective, the cord wouldn't work unless wiggled at the connection next to the in-line volume control. Of course it was an easy return with Amazon but was not happy to wait over a month for the backorder and arrive broken. More importantly, I didn't care for the product itself. It's the pro version so I expected it to be lightweight and well balanced with comfortable ear cups. No, no and no. I replaced them with the Hyper X Cloud II, which I love.
customer_reviews.author: Ferretlaw

customer_reviews.title: mic dies
customer_reviews.text: I love the fit, look and sound of these but the mic function dies after 6 months to a year. I have owned 2 of these. replaced the first one after mic stopped working and now the second one is doing the same. I also own the cloud II that is still working on another PC but it does not have inline volume with out the usb sound amp/card attached. I have a sound card so its not convenient. Putting these on the other computer changes nothing. I switched the mic from the cloud II to these and still nothing so its in the jack or headset itself. It has low sound pick up and intermittent at any control settings.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound at work
customer_reviews.text: The sound on these headphones is awesome. I'm enjoying favorite music in a new way, hearing things I haven't heard on lesser sound systems. The volume control is convenient and easy to use and the headphones themselves are comfortable for hours of use. They do not provide noise cancellation, but when I play a brown noise track they are very effective at blocking out talking even right next to me. Perfect for working in a noisy cube farm. I don't have need for the mic much, but listeners said that my voice was clear the one time I tried it. I like that the mic is removable. The carrying case is very convenient too and has an outside pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine S.

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable headset I have ever worn or owned. The sound quality is good enough, nothing extravagant, but definitely enough to hear what's going on in any situation. Not really Bass-Heavy, the mic audio is pretty good (not spectacular), but it works great and feels amazing when worn. I've worn it for several hours with no discomfort, and there is no slipping/falling off of my head, like my other headphones and headsets tend to do. Great job, Kingston. You guys made a pretty darn good headset that was affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Ashleigh

customer_reviews.title: Good 2-year Warranty
customer_reviews.text: I had these for just over a year and they gave me no problems until recently. I ended up having a minor issue with one of the speakers, a minor crackle noise and only at certain frequencies. The company honored their 2-year warranty. I shipped them the original and they sent me a replacement. I really like these things. Good service. Good Product. It would be better if: 1. The cable were detachable at the unit. (that way you can just replace that cable if it dies) 2. The Mute button were on the headset itself (and not on the dangling cord). But for what I paid for this thing, I'm still happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Josh!

customer_reviews.title: Great Headset!
customer_reviews.text: It was time. My old headset didn't cut the mustard anymore. I read reviews and matched features to my budget and this headset was the clear winner. I bought it. It's great! It's comfortable for long sessions and has excellent sound quality. The inline volume control comes in very handy. I'm glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Kate J.

customer_reviews.title: Happy 5 months in
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 16 y.o. son for gaming on his ps4. He says they're ok. The mic makes crackling noises if he moves it around too much but is fine if he doesn't move it. No issues with audio quality of speakers. He said he'd give the headset 3 of 5 stars but we've been through a few pairs of headphones and he's had problems with other ones in a short time frame so I'm more than happy with these lasting 5 months so far. Sad but true, it seems like you have to spend hundreds of dollars to get a decent gaming headset these days.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Support/Company
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these back in Feb 17', great gaming headset with mic and interchanging cushions. Had the audio connector jack (3.5mm) go faulty on me a few times and the company replaced them with no issue. After the 2nd audio jack went out after 3 months from the replacement, the company is replacing the entire headset. I will continue to buy these headsets in the future. Looking to upgrade for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Cramer

customer_reviews.title: Quality! Money well spent!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my son at Christmas and waited a bit to post a review until they were able to go through his usage and I'm happy to report that they are still going strong, the sound is amazing, hearing him over Discord or other things is crisp, clear, and sometimes too loud (I have to turn his volume down on Discord most of the time). The microphone is attached nicely and the cord is super long and great. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: CL Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: GREAT headphones for gaming and music!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these quite a few months ago and I'm still in love with them. They're very comfortable and cancel out noise well. I can hear the faintest in-game noises with them and it just makes the games I play more immersive. Music sounds great as well and even though I have a really nice speaker set, I still prefer these over my speakers! My boyfriend has kidnapped these from me quite a few times as he loves them too. I was thinking of buying the HyperX Cloud pink headphones and passing these onto him. I'm in love with HyperX Clouds now!
customer_reviews.author: TabithaTop Contributor: Aquascaping

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality!
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. It comes with leather ear-cups already installed, but it has cloth ones depending on what you prefer. I wear these for hours and they are comfortable. The mic works well, and it has a lot of attachments so you can use these with a desktop PC, Laptop, or gaming console.I like the white color a lot and I like that this came with a carrying case because I do travel enough to need it. The cord is very long so I can get up and walk around while listening/talking.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe

customer_reviews.title: These are great! Very comfortable even for hours
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Very comfortable even for hours. Build quality is top notch. The sound quality could be better but for the price it's on par with other brands. By no means is it bad sound just a little light on the lows. I have nothing negative to say about these and they should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: I doubt you can get better sound quality from any set that's marketed as 'gaming'
customer_reviews.text: I doubt you can get better sound quality from any set that's marketed as 'gaming'. They're a re-branded set of TakStar Pro 80, which you can find a ton of reviews for online. They sound great. The mic is good, and removable, which is nice. You can't go wrong with these.
customer_reviews.author: Jason D. McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headset value
customer_reviews.text: I have tried numerous Hyperx headsets but never the original Cloud. Very glad I did as it turns out to be an incredible headset. I use it on the Xbox One with a Astro Mixamp TR and I can hear everything in game very clearly. Add in that the microphone comes across crystal clear and you have a winning headset. It also comes with a bunch of cables to work on many platforms. I modified mine by adding Brainwavz HM5 pads which make it even more comfortable. Highly recommended this headset as its performance far outweighs the price it costs.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis L.

customer_reviews.title: ... have tried about 6 headsets and these are my favorite. I could wear them all day
customer_reviews.text: I have tried about 6 headsets and these are my favorite. I could wear them all day. Most I have to return from hurting my head. People in skype/games say the mic is very clear. They are pretty great sound proof too. They are smaller so you can wear them on the go without having a big gaming headset on your head. The only con I can think of is the mute/sound buttons are on the cord. I would have liked to have them on the headset so I wouldnt have to reach down and find the buttons, but they are so comfortable that I'm perfectly ok with that! They are well worth the price, give them a try!
customer_reviews.author: ~Awful Good Reviews~

customer_reviews.title: Almost...
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought this headset due to the ratings and reviews that it had. When I first tested it out, I noticed that the volume control was a little finicky. When I adjusted the volume I heard a lot of distortion. As the months have passed, the volume has continued to be a persistent issue where up until yesterday I could only get audio when the volume was dialed all the way up. As of now, I am only getting sound out of the left ear. I'm giving it two stars because when the headset worked it was great, outside of that it has been less than optimal.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe

customer_reviews.title: Sunt Bona
customer_reviews.text: These have been great for me; long cord, physical volume control, good sound; good look; comfortable, with ear-holes large enough to actually fit ears... I'm not an audio-obsessed sensualist, so I'm not qualified to speak to you who reach for soundwaves pristine enough to please the ears of gods, but so far as my humble mortal powers can divine, the sound quality is very good. They're comfortable and convenient. They look nice. I have only had them for something on the order of a month, so I can't yet speak to their durability, but there have been no problems so far. 10/10 would buy again if I had 4 ears.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent with XBox One
customer_reviews.text: I bought this headset for my Xbox One and it worked: intermittently, which would drive anybody nuts. I don't mean it was cutting out I mean it would either work or not work once I activated the Xbox or activated the game for which it was intended. This company seems to enjoy a good reputation but maybe I got a lemon? I dunno.
customer_reviews.author: D'Wight

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: The drivers on these headphones are amazing! These headphones will greatly improve your gaming experience. These are great for online games as well as single player games. They just make gaming better and the sound quality is great. Also, since it is a 3.5mm headphone jack I use them to listen to music as well and they are very good for that too!
customer_reviews.author: Thompson82

customer_reviews.title: Good audio quality, comfortable, and reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: If you can get a pair used for ~$60 these are a really good value. Not as clear as sennheisers or anything, but still very good sound, especially with the leather ear cups. However, the leather cups hurt after a while, and I switched to velour. I lost some of the punchiness in the bass, but they're a lot more comfortable now. Velour doesn't get as dirty as people say they do unless you're a total slob lol. The microphone is okay but the tone changes drastically depending on where you position it in relation to your mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Jannell

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: These are decent headphones for the price, VERY comfortable, you get two sets of ear cuffs which were pretty awesome. They sit lightly on your head so you don't get a headache if you use them for long periods of time. I was happy with them, but I ended up returning them for something with a little more volume & surround to them. I bought these for gaming with on the Xbox one & they just didn't work well with it, I couldn't hear where enemies were coming from, explosions weren't loud & realistic enough for me. If you have the money I would suggest Turtle Beach or Astros.
customer_reviews.author: Jason/Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Very good overall
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because I can't seem to find an excellent headset to replace my old Turtle Beach X41 set. These are excellent in every sense, but they don't have the depth and loudness that I'd like. Good construction quality, extremely lightweight, good ear cup dimensions. Another complaint I have is the ear cups are the leatherette covers.. They make my ears sweat.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Tichelaar

customer_reviews.title: HEADSET IS QUITE LITERALLY BUGGED
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to hope this is some kind of error in manufacturing or a problem with my particular unit, but it seems to have an onboard microphone that works even when you remove the detachable mic. This results in medium to high level output from the speakers looping back into the microphone. I can literally remove the detachable mic, tap on the side of my headset and speak very loudly, and get audible microphone input. EVEN WITH THE INLINE MIC SWITCH MUTED, THIS "SECONDARY MIC" IS STILL ON AND FUNCTIONAL.
customer_reviews.author: Parker

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: This headset is really great for this price range. The sound quality is above average, and the full range of audio is extremely clear. Vocal sounds from other users are clear as well. The detachable mic works really nicely, and is somewhat directional. Despite the foam coating, make sure you rotate it to properly face your mouth, or you'll be difficult to hear. This is actually a nice feature, as random other sounds in the room tend not to be picked up.
customer_reviews.author: Dan M

customer_reviews.title: Good headphone!
customer_reviews.text: I have rather big ears, and I can wear this for about an hour or two until my ears start to hurt again. I have 3 headphones- this, Sennheiser HD 598 SR and Corsair VOID PRO RGB Wireless SE. If you have big ears or want better comfort and sounds, Sennheiser is your go-to. If you do not like wires and want your semi dolby experience with RGB, corsair is good. (but its mic sucks) If you have normal/small ears and want a sturdy, well-priced headphone with decent sound, you're at the right place- this should be your choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jin H. Park

customer_reviews.title: Great headset. I headband feels comfortable and durable
customer_reviews.text: Great headset. I headband feels comfortable and durable. The ear cups are replaceable and swappable. I prefer teh velour cups over the leather ones because they are cooler on my skin (allow air to circulate) and I can listen to background noise from other people or things in the room. The one feature missing from the headset is the ability for the microphone to be playback into your headset so you can hear yourself talk. this helps prevent you from talking too loudly with the headset on.
customer_reviews.author: BA

customer_reviews.title: Good headset!
customer_reviews.text: I picked this headset up so that I could communicate on a few online games I play on PC. The cord is plenty long enough and the product fits comfortably. I like that I can detach the mic as well so I don't have to see it out the corner of my eye when I am playing single player games. Incoming sound quality isn't great as far as full headphones go, I have a pair of cheaper headphones that sound better. It isn't bad quality, just nothing to write home about. People say the mic sounds good.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Fantasic Headset!!!
customer_reviews.text: The headset itself is wonderful! The only reason I gave this 4 stars was because of the shipping. It was supposed to be two day shipping, but ended up being four days. I can’t be too angry however because the shipping was free of charge. The sound quality is great and feels super comfortable, the mic quality is great and I love the fact that i can control the volume right at my finger tips instead of opening the menu (on xbox one) to adjust the volume. It is suggested that you have the new controller with the jack so you do not have to buy a attachment. It cancels out a lot of sound and is wonderful feeling.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A Schena

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, with excellent sound at all ranges
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say here other than "wow". Comfortable, with excellent sound at all ranges. This headset has excellent bass, and very clear highs. They come packaged in a premium cushioned box with plenty of adapters and an extension cord. The microphone is detachable and was very clear when used online. The headset cost $70 at the time of my purchase, but had I spent $100+ on them, I still would have been extremely satisfied with this purchase as they're easily on par with headsets twice that price. I reviewed these headsets before purchasing them online, and I must say that all the great things said about these headsets were spot on. Affordable, comfortable, and fantastic sound.
customer_reviews.author: Jose L. Machorro

customer_reviews.title: the fit and comfort of the headphones is much better than the After Glo these replaced
customer_reviews.text: the fit and comfort of the headphones is much better than the After Glo these replaced. Other gamers could now hear me load and clear and I could hear them clearly. The After GLOs everyone complained the volume was way to low and nothing I did corrected that. Only negative I have for this headset is that others online complained that from time to time my voice would sound very robotic and unnatural. I could hear something similar on my end. I do not know if this was a network issue or a characteristic of the headset at this time. Will update as time goes by.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Sound Producing Headphones on the market.
customer_reviews.text: I've had the same pair of Hyper X Cloud Pros for almost 5 years now with ZERO issues. They are the best soundings headphones with 53mm drivers on the market. Crystal clear sound when gaming, and so versatile and clear when it comes to watching movies, shows, and listening music. I bought another set literally just to keep in the box so I never have to worry about switching if these ever die, but by the looks of it they wont. AMAZING BUY.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyTheSinner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for PC, decent for console players.
customer_reviews.text: The mic and sound quality on this headset is awesome and clear. Only bad thing is that it has an impedance of 41 OHMs (the amount of power required to drive the speakers) and consoles can’t push that much power so they sound quiet due to them being wired via 3.5mm. Aside from that, they’re literally perfect.
customer_reviews.author: @KingMzry

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, good sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable, and the sound quality is good but I have to ding it a star for the microphone attachment. It does have a flexible shaft but it plugs into the headphones and as other reviewers have mentioned it is hard plastic. I just don't see this holding up if they are dropped. I mean I need to be able to slam my headphones down when I get mad playing BF4, good gosh that makes me mad when I get knifed!
customer_reviews.author: Sis

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy but I wish the volume went up louder. Some games it was plenty but on a first person shooter just wasn’t quite enough. Still worth the money compared to $150 turtle beach.
customer_reviews.author: WYNSTON GRAY

customer_reviews.title: edit: definitely not worth  80 bucks imo
customer_reviews.text: edit: at first the set feels nice (physically) day one getting audio crackle and short outs, now it seems to happen more often, tried to see if it was the games but two games in a row? probably not. although both digital games. the volume control is garbage. there is like no sound until you've dialed half way and during the audio change, and with anything barely touching the dial (my chest or shoulder) audio crackle, unless i magically got a bum set. i don't recommend these and i will be looking to do a return and refund soon as i can find a way to print the return lable
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas M Fabie

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable, but kinda cheaper quality parts apart from the speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Easily one of the most comfortable headsets i've ever worn. The padding is soft and squishy and after gaming for entire days, listening to music, and watching shows it is a wonderful experience still. However. The sound scroll wheel if not in the perfect spot will cut out sound. The plug only fits perfectly in its own cord splitter. Listening to anything on the laptop or my cell phone is impossible. In my D&D games the headset is set aside for my cellphone app and earbuds with a mic attached.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Donner

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for the first few months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the first few months. Comfortable, decent microphone, long cable. Sound quality started to deteriorate quickly and I'm pretty sure it's the volume control wheel that's on the cord close to the headset. If it's anywhere except the exact perfect rotation the sound becomes static. Would not recommend based on this experience.
customer_reviews.author: Mongoose

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly good audio and pick up from the microphone
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly good audio and pick up from the microphone. I was not aware when I purchased these that they did not support side town ( which is the ability to hear your own voice ), which is the reason for my four star review. The packaging is incredible, quality is obvious, I would certainly buy these again. If you need to side tone, they must be coming out with a model which supports it in the near future. Just be aware the feature does not exist in this particular set.
customer_reviews.author: T. Merritt

customer_reviews.title: the most amazing headset i have ever had in my entire life
customer_reviews.text: the most amazing headset i have ever had in my entire life, the comfort level is OMG IM IN HEAVEN, the made quality they dont break I use to go threw 4 or 5 pc turtle beaches a freakin month I have had this daily use and abuse too they are amazing! sound quality isnt the BEST but its damn good for the price! its very decent audio esepically if you buy sound blaster x with it..... sounds amazing.
customer_reviews.author: garebear29

customer_reviews.title: Good choice in headsets
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my nephew. Almost a year later he's still using and enjoys it. He says it feels fine and he's worn it for some rather long gaming sessions. Plus it seems to have good sound quality (both mic and earphones) from what he's say and what I've observed myself the short time I used it. Since I don't own it and haven't used it more than a few minutes, its difficult for me to say its better/worse than any other headsets at this price hence the 4 stars. But at the $75-80 price range its currently set at on Amazon, I think you'd be hard pressed to find a better headset.
customer_reviews.author: Brett O.

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming headset.
customer_reviews.text: For the price you really can't beat this headset for PC gaming. No batteries required and the sound is excellent. It is very comfortable and doesn't slide around on your head or loosen up as you wear it. It is constructed well and feels very durable in your hands. There are better ones out there but you'll have to pay out the nose for those. Hands down this is the best PC gaming headset under $100, and personally I think it could beat some of the more expensive ones.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Bid

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a month
customer_reviews.text: I loved it while it worked. A greater version of the older model I'd had for years. I bought this on October 24th and it's been great up until today. I was playing for a bit but had to go eat dinner so I unplugged the headset from my controller and set it on a headset stand while I went to go eat. I came back and plugged it in and I had no audio whatsoever. No game sounds, no voice chat, no static, nothin. I plugged in 2 other mics and both worked fine so I know it isnt my controller. It was great until it wasnt
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: they are awesome.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones got me in trouble. I was using them to listen in on the lands of Tamriel, when the wife came in and had to plant her face in front of mine to get my attention. Apparently the noise canceling is "wife yelling from the other room because she needs something" proof (maybe a selling point to some, but a warning to most) get them, they are awesome.
customer_reviews.author: warriorseries

customer_reviews.title: Great Gaming Headset.
customer_reviews.text: Great headset. Really comfortable so far and the removable/adjustable mic is great. I used to buy Razer headsets but the ones that I had weren't really comfortable. This is nice and comfortable though that I can wear for hours on end. There's different inner covers if you want to change it as well. The mic is super nice and clear too.
customer_reviews.author: CTran

customer_reviews.title: It turned out to be my 9 year old son's favorite gift and he has this headset on constantly
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this headset for my 12 year old. Then he told my husband that he was picky and wanted either a Beats or Turtle Beach headset, so I gave it to my younger 9 year old son. Wow! It turned out to be my 9 year old son's favorite gift and he has this headset on constantly. He has a speech difficulty and I think these help people understand him more clearly. BTW, the 12 year old tried out this headset and purchased a black one of these and he too wears his all the time . . . They say it cancels noise exceptionally well and are super comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: ikare

customer_reviews.title: Amazing head set, comfortable and great mic!
customer_reviews.text: One of the most comfortable head sets I have ever owned. I typically get a headache after a few hours with most any other headset, but I have had 12 hour gaming sessions with no ache with this set. The sound isn't amazing by any stretch, but good enough and people tell me the mic sounds great. I will be sticking with Cloud head sets for the foreseeable future as the quality of this head set is amazing for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Harry W.

customer_reviews.title: the presentation outshines the actual product.
customer_reviews.text: packaging is beautiful, the most beautiful packaging i have ever seen, but the headphones are something else. The sound quality on the headphones, especially for music and gaming is superb. However skype calls are a different story. The microphone quality is abysmal, and the headphones were not loud enough. Even on max volume they just did not produce enough sound. I also had a faint static/white noise in the background when not listening to anything which wasn't a huge problem, but annoying nonetheless. I had to return these and ended up getting Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Solomon

customer_reviews.title: Best affordable headset
customer_reviews.text: To me this is the best bang for the buck headset you can get. Microphone quality is good enough to where no one will complain of quality and the sound is always been good for me. I'm not a person that is able to tell much difference between high end and mid end headphones though. Also the headphones are good are cutting sound out from around you if you need that.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Not good for big ears, mic doesn't always work well. Sound is great
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are great but as someone who is always on a computer and in calls with others or gaming, these headphones begin to hurt my ears after a few hours of use. I often catch myself massaging my ears after using these. My ears are larger than average. I have also had issues with these headphones mic. Sometimes people cannot hear me unless the mic is directly next to my lips which can be quite annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Prad

customer_reviews.title: Weak bass, horrible volume control dial
customer_reviews.text: Sound was pretty good, clear in the higher frequencies but weak in the lower ones. It dampens outside sound pretty nicely. Comfortable to wear. The on-wire volume control dial is terrible. Causes scratchy noise when you try to dial it up or down, and you lose sound in either ear depending on where the dial is turned. Dial is also fidgety, and can be easily bumped all the way up or down unintentionally. Two stars for the bad design of this essential part.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable over-ear headphones/headset I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: I had lots of headphones and headsets. Before trying out HyperX cloud series, I was using G933. This cloud pro is ultimately comfortable and with an okay quality of sound. This headset is more comfortable than BOSE QC 25, and better sound quality than Logitech G430. Good price for this quality. Note: This headset is sosososososo comfortable even after 5 hours of gaming. And I am a glass wearer as well. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Lovely headset to buy at the right price
customer_reviews.text: This headset sounds accurate and a prominent bass to it. Construction is made of quality, slightly rubberized plastic, leather, and aluminum. The leather earpads are super soft and fit my ear, but my ears get warm really quickly afterward. However, I don't notice it after about 5-10 minutes or so when gaming. I really like the feel and sturdiness of the aluminum band that has little divots to denote levels of adjustment. Overall, 4/5 stars. By the way, I bought this at $42.10 that came with a free carrying case, so [it's] worth my money.
customer_reviews.author: A.H.

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, Excellent Audio, Durability, and Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I've had this headset for 2 years and it is still delivering excellent audio, Durability has been great, no loose connections in the wires or any kind of issues with the headband and ear-cups. I would also like to note the excellent customer service provided by Kingston. I needed a replacement adapter (Misplaced) to make the headset work fully with my PS4 controller. The rep I just spoke to handled my request in a few short moments, without requiring proof of purchase and no shipping charge. Excellent set, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Schilz

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the most comfortable headset that I've tried so far, I can wear it for hours at a time and never feel that discomfort and pain that I got with all other headsets before. The sound quality is great as well and the mic does its job, this will do for me for a couple years I hope!
customer_reviews.author: Lord_Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: I take very good care of my products. I've had this paid of headphones for about 4 months now and they've been great. The sounds quality and comfort are very good, however in the last couple of weeks I began noticing that only one speaker would play sometimes. It's been getting progressively worse, the cable is begging to fail. It now have to move it around and hold it at weird angles to get sound on both speakers. At times it gets so annoying I take them off and use my backup pair. And there are times where I get no sound from either speaker, I wish they would have used better quality cables and/or connectors.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Garnica

customer_reviews.title: best value for the price
customer_reviews.text: BEST headset I've ever owned. super compfy headband, barely feels like anything's on your head. The removable boom (with cap) is absolutely convenient for just listening to music if you aren't voice chatting with anybody. All of the additional plug accessories were amazing and it's really cool that you get so many choices of how to use the headset. The pleather ear cups are wonderful and block out noise extremely well and the "velour" ear cups are really soft and comfortable. the only downside is they can't be used with xbox.
customer_reviews.author: Elliot DePlanty

customer_reviews.title: Go Buy These Now!
customer_reviews.text: You've probably already heard about how good this headset is with all the other reviews, but I just wanted to confirm what everyone else says, it's simply the best gaming headset on the market for the 50-100 dollar range! It's super good sounding (not even that far off of my BeyerDynamic DT770 Pro's), the mic is nice, they're lightweight, just big enough to cover the ears but still small enough to throw in a bag, and overall just great!
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality
customer_reviews.text: Great build quality. but the only problem is that it makes a buzzing and humming noise when I use the inline-mute option.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered these headphones a second time after my old set finally died after 2 years of constant use. These headphones are amazing. The sound is good and the noise cancelling is great, it really does block out almost all outside noise.(When wearing them I barely hear someone who is talking right beside me). They are also very comfortable. I wear them almost all day on weekends and I've never had issues with discomfort or pain.
customer_reviews.author: Kale

customer_reviews.title: Great for all gamers and, especially, late night gamers with roommates.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a friend of mine who happens to be a hardcore WoW player; frequent raids and late nights on Skype and Vent with his buddies and potential-but-totally-not-until-she-leaves-her-fiance-but-still-kinda-girlfriend. The sound quality and build of these sexy little ear-cups is incredible for the price you pay. I got these at 60%-ish off, which was lovely. He's been using these daily. I personally love them because I don't have to hear the near constant whooshing and explosions of his frost mage at 2am anymore.
customer_reviews.author: L00fah

customer_reviews.title: a problem he's run into with other headsets like Turtle Beach
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my boyfriend for Christmas and he absolutely loves them. They work perfectly for what he needs, especially the adapter that makes the headphones only require one jack for both the headphones and the mike on the computer, a problem he's run into with other headsets like Turtle Beach.
customer_reviews.author: Clem

customer_reviews.title: More than one use
customer_reviews.text: Noise cancellation works well, so I can tune out the room when I'm gaming. Being able to remove the mic is an extra bonus, for that time I want to hook it to my phone, put on something to relax to, close my eyes and tune out the world. Very comfortable, but you know they're there.
customer_reviews.author: Steven L. Krantz

customer_reviews.title: Arrived not working
customer_reviews.text: This is the second HyperX headset I've bought. This one arrived earlier today and when I plugged it in, the mic picked up indistinguishable sound while I was able to listen to music perfectly. After checking my input setting and trying different usb and microphone jacks I found that the only sound I was able to pic up was loud fuzz and even if I was to tap the mic directly it would BARELY resonate. What a terrible headset. I will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Significant crosstalk problem
customer_reviews.text: There is a huge issue with this headset that buyers should know before they spend their money. This headset has significant crosstalk issues. This is apparent on PC however on console this headset is good. If you plan on using this headset without the microphone than I recommend, however using these with discord for example is not good, others will be able to hear EVERYTHING you are doing. This includes your youtube videos and game volume for example. Please take this into consideration before you buy. I would recommend this product for console gamers but for PC I would take a look at the cloud II or revolver from the same manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Shay Hohokabe

customer_reviews.title: Great sound!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a headset that sounds and feels good to the ear (I'm a big sound guy). I recently bought the hyperX alphas and these ones sound way better and are more comfy. Lots of lows middle and high range. I was going to buy the BOSE 35's for trips but honestly these sound just like BOSE with the drawback of not being wireless but if I can safe 300 bucks its a win.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Other than that works just fine on my ps4
customer_reviews.text: Just a couple weeks in and I already hear scratching noises when I adjust the volume. Also when I record voice on my laptop there is a lot of static when I play back the recording. Other than that works just fine on my ps4. This is the silver model.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan hyde

customer_reviews.title: and very importantly comfortable headset. The mic is a bit meh
customer_reviews.text: For the price you pay for this headset you get a hell of a deal. You get some really high quality sound (surprisingly for a full gaming headset), and very importantly comfortable headset. The mic is a bit meh, but the issues other users have reported with the excessive popping I've fixed with buy after market pop filters (stock one is awful). While the mic is a bit meh it works well enough for gaming communication, it's obviously wasn't going to be studio quality so I'm not bothered by it. Pop filter I bought "Tetra-Teknica XFFZ5P-BLK Lapel & Headset Microphone Windscreen" you can find it on amazon for about $6 in a 5 pack.
customer_reviews.author: Comanglia

customer_reviews.title: Mic input issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought this twice and both times I had the same issue. The mic input is very low and there’s no way to increase. Tried through the app I was using (discord) and tried through my computer. Anyone I played with couldn’t or could BARELY hear me. Next was if I barely touched the cord, it would make an unpleasant static noise for myself and whoever I was talking to.I no longer use HyperX headsets for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Erynn08

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Adjustable to fit anyone's ear. Sometimes when I communicate to people it makes the mic jack slightly come off. have to push it back in. the cabes are nice and comes with piesces to fit xbox, ps4, or pc. it was a little pricey for what it does. wish it had better audio. overall it blocks outside noise pretty well. 4/5
customer_reviews.author: Tragedy

product_meta.title: HyperX Cloud Pro Gaming Headset - Silver - with in-Line Audio Control for PS4, Xbox One, and PC (HX-HSCL-SR/NA)
product_meta.description: Color:Silver - with In-Line Audio Control| Style:HeadsetHyperX cloud is designed to meet the demands of serious console gamers. Cloud in silver has convenient in-line audio control that saves you from navigating through system menus and puts control at your fingertips. The durable aluminum frame is designed for long-lasting reliability and to withstand the damage of daily gaming. The 100% memory foam ear cushions and leatherette-padded headband provide award-winning comfort for those long weekends and Late nights of gaming. Hi-fi capable 53mm drivers and enhanced bass reproduction pump out crystal clear high, mids and lows, and the closed Cup design silences the outside world to completely immerse you in your game. Cloud's Microphone can be adjusted The way you like it, and it eliminates background noise so you come across loud and clear. When you're ready to listen to music, simply unplug the microphone and stow it for later. HyperX cloud has been certified by TeamSpeak and Discord and is compatible with Skype, ventrilo, mumble, RAID call and many more chat applications. During HyperX cloud testing, no audible echoes, background noise or voice distortions were detected, so you and your team will be able to communicate clearly. HyperX Cloud's 3.5mm Plug (4 Pole) is compatible with PS4, XBOX one1, Wii U, macr and mobile devices2, and it comes with a 2M extension cable with stereo and mic plugs for PC use. Microphone Frequency response 50Hz (Hertz) – 18,000 Hz(Hertz).
feature_bullets: In line Audio Volume control and Microphone mute
Durable aluminum frame. Detachable noise cancelling Microphone
Memory foam ear cushions provide award winning comfort for marathon gaming sessions
53 millimeter drivers pump out lush Audio to fully immerse you in the game
Backed by 2 year warranty and free technical support ,6am to 6 pm PST,M F.Type: Circumpolar, Closed back

specifications.Series: HyperX Cloud Pro Gaming Headset - Silver - with In-Line Audio Control for P
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars4,907 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
